Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Thorough \Thor"ough\, a. 1. Passing through; as, thorough lights in a house. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
2. Passing through or to the end; hence, complete; perfect; as, a thorough reformation; thorough work; a thorough translator; a thorough poet. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Thorough \Thor"ough\, adv. 1. Thoroughly. [Obs. or Colloq.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
2. Through. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Thorough \Thor"ough\, n. A furrow between two ridges, to drain off the surface water. [Prov. Eng.] --Halliwell. [1913 Webster]

thorough adj 1: painstakingly careful and accurate; "our accountant is thorough"; "thorough research" 2: very thorough; exhaustively complete; "an exhaustive study"; "made a thorough search"; "thoroughgoing research" [syn: {exhaustive}, {thoroughgoing}]
